comment: Defines fields exposed through the /voicemail path of this content provider.

variables.name: CONTENT_URI
variables.comment: URI to insert/retrieve voicemails.

variables.name: DIR_TYPE
variables.comment: The MIME type for a collection of voicemails.

variables.name: ITEM_TYPE
variables.comment: The MIME type for a single voicemail.

variables.name: NUMBER
variables.comment:
* Phone number of the voicemail sender. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: DATE
variables.comment:
* The date the voicemail was sent, in milliseconds since the epoch *

Type: INTEGER (long)

variables.name: DURATION
variables.comment:
* The duration of the voicemail in seconds. *

Type: INTEGER (long)

variables.name: NEW
variables.comment:
* Whether or not the voicemail has been acknowledged (notification sent to the user). *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

variables.name: IS_READ
variables.comment:
* Whether this item has been read or otherwise consumed by the user. *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

variables.name: STATE
variables.comment:
* The mail box state of the voicemail. This field is currently not used by the system. *

Possible values: {@link #STATE_INBOX}, {@link #STATE_DELETED}, * {@link #STATE_UNDELETED}. *

Type: INTEGER

* @hide

variables.name: STATE_INBOX
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #STATE} when the voicemail is in inbox.
         * @hide

variables.name: STATE_DELETED
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #STATE} when the voicemail has been marked as deleted.
         * @hide

variables.name: STATE_UNDELETED
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #STATE} when the voicemail has marked as undeleted.
         * @hide

variables.name: SOURCE_PACKAGE
variables.comment:
* Package name of the source application that inserted the voicemail. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: SOURCE_DATA
variables.comment:
* Application-specific data available to the source application that * inserted the voicemail. This is typically used to store the source * specific message id to identify this voicemail on the remote * voicemail server. *

Type: TEXT

*

Note that this is NOT the voicemail media content data.

variables.name: HAS_CONTENT
variables.comment:
* Whether the media content for this voicemail is available for * consumption. *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

variables.name: MIME_TYPE
variables.comment:
* MIME type of the media content for the voicemail. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: TRANSCRIPTION
variables.comment:
* The transcription of the voicemail entry. This will only be populated if the voicemail * entry has a valid transcription. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: TRANSCRIPTION_STATE
variables.comment:
* The state of the voicemail transcription. *

Possible values: {@link #TRANSCRIPTION_NOT_STARTED}, * {@link #TRANSCRIPTION_IN_PROGRESS}, {@link #TRANSCRIPTION_FAILED}, * {@link #TRANSCRIPTION_AVAILABLE}. *

Type: INTEGER

* @hide

variables.name: TRANSCRIPTION_NOT_STARTED
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #TRANSCRIPTION_STATE} when the voicemail transcription has not yet
         * been attempted.
         * @hide

variables.name: TRANSCRIPTION_IN_PROGRESS
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #TRANSCRIPTION_STATE} when the voicemail transcription has begun
         * but is not yet complete.
         * @hide

variables.name: TRANSCRIPTION_FAILED
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #TRANSCRIPTION_STATE} when the voicemail transcription has
         * been attempted and failed.
         * @hide

variables.name: TRANSCRIPTION_AVAILABLE
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #TRANSCRIPTION_STATE} when the voicemail transcription has
         * completed and the result has been stored in the {@link #TRANSCRIPTION} column.
         * @hide

variables.name: _DATA
variables.comment:
* Path to the media content file. Internal only field.
         * @hide

variables.name: PHONE_ACCOUNT_COMPONENT_NAME
variables.comment:
* The {@link ComponentName} of the {@link PhoneAccount} in string form. The * {@link PhoneAccount} of the voicemail is used to differentiate voicemails from different * sources. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: PHONE_ACCOUNT_ID
variables.comment:
* The identifier of a {@link PhoneAccount} that is unique to a specified * {@link ComponentName}. The {@link PhoneAccount} of the voicemail is used to differentiate * voicemails from different sources. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: DIRTY
variables.comment:
* Flag used to indicate that local, unsynced changes are present. * Currently, this is used to indicate that the voicemail was read or deleted. * The value will be 1 if dirty is true, 0 if false. * *

When a caller updates a voicemail row (either with {@link ContentResolver#update} or * {@link ContentResolver#applyBatch}), and if the {@link ContentValues} doesn't contain * this column, the voicemail provider implicitly sets it to 0 if the calling package is * the {@link #SOURCE_PACKAGE} or to 1 otherwise. To prevent this behavior, explicitly set * {@link #DIRTY_RETAIN} to DIRTY in the {@link ContentValues}. * *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

* * @see #DIRTY_RETAIN

variables.name: DIRTY_RETAIN
variables.comment:
* Value of {@link #DIRTY} when updating to indicate that the value should not be updated
         * during this operation.

variables.name: DELETED
variables.comment:
* Flag used to indicate that the voicemail was deleted but not synced to the server. * A deleted row should be ignored. * The value will be 1 if deleted is true, 0 if false. *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

variables.name: LAST_MODIFIED
variables.comment:
* The date the row is last inserted, updated, or marked as deleted, in milliseconds * since the epoch. Read only. *

Type: INTEGER (long)

variables.name: BACKED_UP
variables.comment:
* Flag to indicate the voicemail was backed up. The value will be 1 if backed up, 0 if * not. * *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

variables.name: RESTORED
variables.comment:
* Flag to indicate the voicemail was restored from a backup. The value will be 1 if * restored, 0 if not. * *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

variables.name: ARCHIVED
variables.comment:
* Flag to indicate the voicemail was marked as archived. Archived voicemail should not be * deleted even if it no longer exist on the server. The value will be 1 if archived true, 0 * if not. * *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

variables.name: IS_OMTP_VOICEMAIL
variables.comment:
* Flag to indicate the voicemail is a OMTP voicemail handled by the {@link * android.telephony.VisualVoicemailService}. The UI should only show OMTP voicemails from * the current visual voicemail package. For example, the selection could be * {@code WHERE (IS_OMTP_VOICEMAIL == 0) OR ( IS_OMTP_VOICEMAIL == 1 AND SOURCE_PACKAGE == * "current.vvm.package")} * *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

* * @see android.telephony.TelephonyManager#getVisualVoicemailPackageName

methods.name: public static Uri buildSourceUri(String packageName)
methods.comment:
* A convenience method to build voicemail URI specific to a source package by appending
         * {@link VoicemailContract#PARAM_KEY_SOURCE_PACKAGE} param to the base URI.

methods.name: public static Uri insert(Context context, Voicemail voicemail)
methods.comment:
* Inserts a new voicemail into the voicemail content provider.
         *
         * @param context The context of the app doing the inserting
         * @param voicemail Data to be inserted
         * @return {@link Uri} of the newly inserted {@link Voicemail}
         *
         * @hide

methods.name: public static int insert(Context context, List<Voicemail> voicemails)
methods.comment:
* Inserts a list of voicemails into the voicemail content provider.
         *
         * @param context The context of the app doing the inserting
         * @param voicemails Data to be inserted
         * @return the number of voicemails inserted
         *
         * @hide

methods.name: public static int deleteAll(Context context)
methods.comment:
* Clears all voicemails accessible to this voicemail content provider for the calling
         * package. By default, a package only has permission to delete voicemails it inserted.
         *
         * @return the number of voicemails deleted
         *
         * @hide

methods.name: private static ContentValues getContentValues(Voicemail voicemail)
methods.comment: * Maps structured {@link Voicemail} to {@link ContentValues} in content provider.

methodNames: public static Uri insert(Context context, Voicemail voicemail)
public static int insert(Context context, List<Voicemail> voicemails)
